verses.roman:
"tomāra jyeṭhā nirbuddhi aṣṭa-lakṣa khāya
āmi--bhāgī, āmāre kichu dibāre yuyāya

synonyms: tomāra jyeṭhā—the elder brother of your father; nirbuddhi—bereft of intelligence; aṣṭa-lakṣa khāya—enjoys 800,000 coins; āmi—I; bhāgī—shareholder, āmāre—unto me; kichu—something; dibāre—to give; yuyāya—is proper.
translation: "The elder brother of your father is less intelligent," he said. "He enjoys of it to me.
